text: this is get eaten for the New York Times
here are a few video editing apps
that'll help you transform your
smartphone's video library into a
stunning short film free on iOS is cute
cut offering a well-designed clean
interface which organizes your video
clips on the timeline a double click
will allow you to trim crop your video
clips and it's also fairly simple to add
commentary and music to your timeline to
enhance your films however adding
transitions between Clips can get a bit
tricky and the free version only allows
you to edit fairly short movies with a
watermark that reads make a cute cut for
longer length films without the
watermark you'll have to shell out three
dollars 99 for the premium version for a
simpler experience there's the video
edit app on iOS though this app has an
easy to use minimalist interface it's
very limiting
you can only stack with your clips in
succession without any fun transitions
or cinema lock effects on the plus side
I like that video editor allows you to
easily share your finished videos of our
email Facebook or YouTube
finally for Android and iOS is the free
Magisto magical video editor with this
app you can layer your video clips with
themes like bets party and sentimental
which add effects like blurs sparkles
and colors to your videos however the
app can be a bit confusing to use and if
you want to save your final videos
you'll have to sign up with Magisto for
a free account these apps could make
your mobile video a lot more fun to
watch but they won't be winning an Oscar
any time see
